awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Inverse Problems for Hyperbolic      Partial Differential Equations
awd_abstract_narration: 8905878                                                                         Symes                                                                                This project will address three questions in the area of                   inverse problems for hyperbolic equations:  The degree to which                 regularity propagates according to bicharacteristic geometry                    for equations with nonsmooth coefficients, the well-posedness                   and computability via Newton-type algorithms for constrained                    optimization problems, and the characterization and computation                 of solutions for weakly convex optimization problems.                           The mathematics developed here will be used to determine the                    interior structure of the earth from seismological data.  This                  is very useful in determining the location of natural resources                 without the expensive boring of wells.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
